objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Author and publisher of the report. The report draws on information derived from NCSC, MOD and industry sources, and includes YARA rules authored by NCSC.

objects.name: First-stage hosting domain
objects.description: Delivery infrastructure used to host the signed first-stage malware executable during the spear-phishing campaign.

objects.name: Second-stage delivery domain
objects.description: Domain used by the first stage to download the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK download URL
objects.description: Observed URL serving the DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK C2 domain
objects.description: Command-and-control domain used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to beacon over HTTP on port 8080.

objects.name: Final-stage DLL path used for COM hijack
objects.description: Location where DAMASCENED PEACOCK saves the downloaded third-stage payload and sets it for COM hijack in explorer.exe.

objects.name: COM hijack InprocServer32 (CLSID F82B4EF1-93A9-4DDE-8015-F7950A1A6E31)
objects.description: Registry key hijacked by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to gain persistence and execute the downloaded payload within explorer.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (MD5)
objects.description: Signed first-stage downloader used in spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF. Original PE metadata name: PortDocFormat.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: Signed first-stage downloader used in spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF. Original PE metadata name: PortDocFormat.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: Signed first-stage downloader used in spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF. Original PE metadata name: PortDocFormat.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (MD5)
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL (32-bit) loaded by the first stage to download and execute the final stage.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL (32-bit) loaded by the first stage to download and execute the final stage.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL (32-bit) loaded by the first stage to download and execute the final stage.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows and delivered via spear-phishing. It is implemented as a 32-bit (x86) DLL with a single export named DllExport and operates as the second of three stages. It is loaded within the signed first-stage process and downloads the final stage, persisting and executing it via a COM Hijack by modifying the InprocServer32 entry for CLSID {F82B4EF1-93A9-4DDE-8015-F7950A1A6E31} to point to %LOCALAPPDATA%\KeyStore\KeyProv.dll. It employs defense evasion techniques including XOR-based string obfuscation and dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs using a custom API hashing algorithm. Communications are proxy-aware and use WinHTTP to beacon via HTTP on port 8080 to apimonger[.]com, posting a payload request (get_update_manager64 or get_update_manager32) depending on host architecture. The stage is downloaded from journalctl[.]website and is a variant related to RustyClaw and SnipBot in the broader RomCom malware family, now split across two stages where DAMASCENED PEACOCK sits between RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: Referenced as a variant documented by Talos and part of the wider RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is positioned between RustyClaw and DustyHammock in the multi-stage chain.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: Referenced as a variant documented by Palo Alto Networks (Unit 42) and part of the wider RomCom malware family in campaigns related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: Referenced as the third stage in the chain following DAMASCENED PEACOCK, within the broader RomCom malware family.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: A malware family encompassing variants such as RustyClaw and SnipBot, with DAMASCENED PEACOCK identified as part of this family and positioned between RustyClaw and DustyHammock in the staged infection chain.

objects.name: UK Ministry of Defence (MOD)
objects.description: Targeted organization; detected a spear-phishing campaign in late 2024 aimed at delivering malware to staff.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Referenced industry source; documented the RustyClaw variant within the RomCom malware family (see provided URL).

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks Unit 42
objects.description: Referenced industry source; documented the SnipBot variant within the RomCom malware family (see provided URL).

objects.name: GlobalSign nv-sa
objects.description: Issuer of the EV Code Signing CA listed in the report’s certificate details (GlobalSign GCC R45 EV CodeSigning CA 2020).

objects.name: GlobalSign GCC R45 EV CodeSigning CA 2020
objects.description: Certificate Authority referenced in the code signing certificate details for the first-stage executable.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Subject of the code signing certificate used to sign the first-stage executable that loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Deobfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Deobfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with Dynamic Resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
